title: Tsunami
marks: Signature and Date on bottom, incised: [Michael Lee (illegible) 2001]
text: Lee began turning wood as a hobby, purchasing a lathe and teaching himself to turn wood.  After a few years, Lee decided to turn wood full time and in preparation for this career change he pursued formal training at the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts in Tennessee.  The swirling tsunami depicted in this piece is an example of Lee's desire to "breath[e] life into the work through gesture and movement."
description: abstract sculptural piece of organic form; two golden brown ovoid shapes surrounded by shiny dark brown swirling elements; dull brown between; textured overall with tiny indentations
creditline: Gift of Daniel Greenberg and Susan Steinhauser
